vehicles.description: There are several cars on the same side ahead; some appear to have stopped, while one might be moving.
vehicles.explanation: Vehicles in the distance may restrict the lane usage of this vehicle, and if there are vehicles in motion, one needs to stay alert for unpredictable behavior.

traffic cones.description: Traffic cones are arranged at the roadside, marking the area where driving is prohibited.
traffic cones.explanation: These cone-shaped markers indicate that self-driving cars should stay within the lane and not deviate towards the roadside.

barriers.description: The metal fence extends along the right side of the road, separating the road from the adjacent property.
barriers.explanation: This barrier represents an insurmountable boundary, guiding self-driving vehicles to stay within the road limits.

other objects.description: Cement piles placed at regular intervals along the right edge of the sidewalk.
other objects.explanation: The function of these bollards is to protect pedestrians and property from vehicle damage and to guide autonomous vehicles to stay within the designated lanes.

other objects.description: Beside the traffic cone on the roadside, there is a black trash can.
other objects.explanation: The trash can is located on the outer side of the road and does not affect the driving behavior of this car, as long as it stays off the road.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there are several cars ahead on the same side of the road. Some of these cars appear to have stopped, while at least one may be in motion. The presence of these vehicles may restrict lane usage for the self-driving car, and the potential movement of any of these cars requires vigilance for unpredictable behavior.

Additionally, traffic cones are positioned at the roadside, clearly marking an area where driving is not allowed. These cones serve as a visual cue for autonomous vehicles to remain within the lane and avoid deviating towards the roadside.

A metal fence runs along the right side of the road, delineating the boundary between the road and the adjacent property. This barrier is an important guide for self-driving vehicles to maintain their path within the road limits.

Other objects observed include cement piles placed at regular intervals along the right edge of the sidewalk. These bollards are intended to protect pedestrians and property from any vehicular damage and to ensure that autonomous vehicles stay within the designated driving lanes. Additionally, there is a black trash can beside the traffic cone on the roadside. This trash can is situated on the outer side of the road and should not influence the driving behavior of the autonomous vehicle as long as it remains off the road.

driving_suggestion: Maintain your lane and speed while paying attention to any movement of vehicles ahead, and be prepared to slow down if necessary. Exercise caution when overtaking, checking for oncoming traffic since the visibility ahead may be limited. Obey road laws and traffic rules. Keep a safe following distance from the vehicle in front. Continue to observe changes in road conditions or the appearance of traffic control devices such as signs, signals, or other road users.

1.description and explanation: The object is a traffic cone, often used to mark areas that require caution or to redirect traffic away from a certain section of the road. Its presence may suggest road work, an obstacle, or an area where driving may be restricted. The ego car should prepare to slow down and possibly change lanes or navigate around the cone, while closely observing the road for further instructions or obstructions.

2.description and explanation: A traffic cone is an object designed for road traffic management, typically used for channeling vehicles away from specific areas, such as construction zones, hazards on the road, or to demarcate lanes during times of road work or accidents. The traffic cone in view likely indicates either an obstruction or alteration in the usual traffic flow ahead. As a result, the driver of the ego car should prepare to slow down and proceed with caution, following any new lane arrangements or detours that the cone may mark.
